Judges of the 16th Annual Exhibition of Newspaper Typography held in Philadelphia, April 17, under the auspices of N.W. Ayer & Son, Inc. Left to right: Harold Van Doren, industrial designer, Laurence B. Siegfried, type expert, and Lowell Thomas, radio commentator.

Nora and Heriberto Bohtlingk

[inside of card] With all good wishes for Christmas and the New Year from Nora and Heriberto Bohtlingk. After our trip to India and around the world we enjoyed your 'Land of the Black Pagoda' which you sent us after the dinner party at the Palmeds last January - Konarek[?] was certanly amazing

Verso: [inside of card] With all good wishes for Christmas and the New Year from Nora and Heriberto Bohtlingk. After our trip to India and around the world we enjoyed your 'Land of the Black Pagoda' which you sent us after the dinner party at the Palmeds last January - Konarek[?] was certanly amazing

Boontown Elks
[Boontown Elks] Feb 3 1941
Verso: Feb 3 1941

Note: "Gertrude", a victum of infantile paralysis, was found by the Boonton Elks' Crippled Children Committee when eleven years of age. She could not walk or even stand on her feet. After three years' treatment she was returned home with only a slight limp and found employment. She was married three years ago ans is shown above with her two-year-old son. Is crippled children work worth while? February 3, 1941.

Bill Mark
Note[PDF]: [letter from Bill Mark to Mary]
[Bill Mark:]Dear Mary and Lowell, I got the five books. They are perfect. I have my four books in the place of honor atop the book shelf, lording it over some three hundred other biographys&

[Bill Mark:]PS I am breaking in a new darkroom printer. I gave her your returned glossy so that she would see just how you wanted it cropped. These are what she came up with&
